column3: the three Rover boys walked to the open doorway of the old mill and went inside. Dick led the way and crossed to where an enclosed stairs ran to the floor below. On tiptoes he went down
column4: not trusting a step until he was sure of his footing. It was well he did this
column5: for two of the steps were entirely rotted away
column6: and he had to warn his brothers
column7: otherwise one or another might have had a fall.Standing in the wheel room of the old mill the boys saw another streak of light
column8: coming from the room which Dick had suggested. The door to this was closed
column9: a bolt on the inner side holding it in place. There was another bolt on the outside
column10: which Dick remembered having seen on a previous visit.
